intro: Secamone drepanoloba, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical climbing plant native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, winged berries. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. The botanical features of Secamone drepanoloba make it an interesting subject for both ecological and pharmacological studies.
